comments.body: Is there any reason to pass `ourRuntimeType` here anymore?
I've left this in. We can look at this API in a separate pass.
the comment above is wrong (in particular, it explicitly says it does the work backwards)
This function has other customers; I guess they need to handle detachChild also in due course.
Yeah, the changes here shouldn't be harmful to them, but they don't all support detachChild yet.

Do we want to assert something about the state of the _owner field if the parent is null?  For example, perhaps its supposed to always be null.  Maybe we should assert that at the entry to this function?

I was trying to avoid forcing an ordering to lines 168 and 169 in widgets/binding.dart.

Now that I take a second look at this, though, I'm wondering if it would be easier just to pass the owner in the constructor. In that case, the assertion would be that if the parent is null, the owner field should already be non-null.
Ah, I remember now, the constructor is called in a method whose signature would be disruptive to change.
trivial nit: we normally put the property below the getter to avoid the dartdoc being sandwiched between the two.
